h3.span: NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that on Thursday, May 14, 2020 at 7:30 p.m. or as soon thereafter as practicable at the regularly scheduled meeting of the AADUSD, which will be held in 32248 Crown Valley Rd. Acton, CAÂ 93510, the Board of Education will consider for approval a resolution adopting findings required by Government Code section 4217.10 et seq. regarding anticipated energy cost savings and other benefits from entering into the Solar Energy Power Purchase Agreement ("Agreement") proposed by PFMG Solar, LLC ("PFMG"). Pursuant to the Agreement, PFMG will design, construct, install, and operate solar electrical energy generation facilities on District property, accessible through an easement.Â The resolution and supporting documents will be on the Regular Agenda for public comment and proposed action.

div.div: Posted by Mr. Larry King on 4/2/2020

div.p:
Good evening parents and students.Â This is Mr. King, superintendent of the AADUSD.Â The message from Governor Gavin Newsom, State Superintendent of Instruction, Tony Thurmond, and LACOE Superintendent, Dr. Debra Duardo, has been consistent over the past 48 hours.Â They have all recommended that schools across the state remain closed through the remainder of the school year.Â
The decision to close a school rests within the scope of the local school board and superintendent, at least at this point in time.Â I am in agreement that keeping our schools closed to the public for the remainder of the school year is the most prudent thing to do for the protection of our students, staff, families, and community members.Â
This is an extremely difficult recommendation I will be making to the Board of Education next Thursday evening.Â Pending Board approval of my recommendation we will continue to provide instruction for the remainder of the school year through distance learning.Â This is not an early start to a summer break.Â Our teachers, administrators, and support staff have worked extremely hard to ensure your studentâ€™s education continues.Â
In Los Angeles County the number of people who have tested positive for the coronavirus continues to rise each day.Â It is my opinion that we must continue to do our part by practicing social distancing whenever and wherever possible.Â
Students, our teachers are here for you.Â Please know you can request to speak to your teacher anytime.Â They will make time for you as they always have.Â Parents, the same applies to you.Â We know how difficult this is.Â Many of our teachers have their own children at home and understand firsthand the challenges you are facing.Â
While I know many of us are angry, hurt, sad, or frustrated that all the amazing activities that normally take place at the end of the school year are now cancelled, at least any live version of those activities.Â We have to find new and innovative ways to celebrate student successes through the use of technology such as live video streaming.Â We owe that to our students.Â
Thank you, be safe, be healthy, and have a good evening.Â

a.aria-label: Go to comments for COVID-19 Announcements 4/2/20

div.div: Posted by Mr. Larry King on 4/2/2020

div.p: Buenas tardes padres y alumnos. Este es el Sr. King, superintendente de AADUSD. El mensaje del Gobernador Gavin Newsom, el Superintendente de InstrucciÃ³n del Estado, Tony Thurmond, y el Superintendente de LACOE, Dra. Debra Duardo, ha sido constante durante las Ãºltimas 48 horas. Todos han recomendado que las escuelas en todo el estado permanezcan cerradas durante el resto del aÃ±o escolar.

La decisiÃ³n de cerrar una escuela estÃ¡ dentro del alcance de la junta escolar local y el superintendente, al menos en este momento. Estoy de acuerdo en que mantener nuestras escuelas cerradas al pÃºblico por el resto de los aÃ±os escolares es lo mÃ¡s prudente para proteger a nuestros estudiantes, personal, familias y miembros de la comunidad.

Esta es una recomendaciÃ³n extremadamente difÃ­cil que harÃ© a la Junta de EducaciÃ³n el prÃ³ximo jueves por la noche. En espera de la aprobaciÃ³n de mi recomendaciÃ³n por parte de la Junta, continuaremos brindando instrucciÃ³n para el resto de la escuela a travÃ©s del aprendizaje a distancia. Este no es un comienzo temprano para las vacaciones de verano. Nuestros maestros, administradores y personal de apoyo han trabajado muy duro para garantizar que la educaciÃ³n de sus estudiantes continÃºe.

En el condado de Los Ãngeles, el nÃºmero de personas que dieron positivo para el coronavirus continÃºa aumentando cada dÃ­a. Es mi opiniÃ³n que debemos continuar haciendo nuestra parte practicando el distanciamiento social siempre que sea posible. Somos una funciÃ³n esencial y, por lo tanto, continuamos operando en todas las Ã¡reas de mantenimiento, operaciones, nÃ³mina, contabilidad, personal e instrucciÃ³n. La forma en que llevamos a cabo este trabajo ha cambiado drÃ¡sticamente y estamos agradecidos por su paciencia y comprensiÃ³n.

Estudiantes, nuestros maestros estÃ¡n aquÃ­ para ustedes. Tenga en cuenta que puede solicitar hablar con su maestro en cualquier momento. Te harÃ¡n tiempo como siempre lo han hecho. Padres, lo mismo se aplica a ustedes. Sabemos lo difÃ­cil que es esto. Muchos de nuestros maestros tienen sus propios hijos en casa y entienden de primera mano los desafÃ­os que enfrenta.

Si bien sÃ© que muchos de nosotros estamos enojados, heridos, tristes o frustrados porque todas las actividades increÃ­bles que normalmente tienen lugar al final del aÃ±o escolar ahora se cancelan, al menos cualquier versiÃ³n en vivo de esas actividades. Tenemos que encontrar formas nuevas e innovadoras para celebrar los Ã©xitos de los estudiantes mediante el uso de tecnologÃ­a como la transmisiÃ³n de video en vivo. Se lo debemos a nuestros estudiantes.
Gracias, estÃ© seguro, saludable y que tenga una buena noche.

div.div: Posted by Acton-Agua Dulce Unified School District on 3/30/2020

div.h3: Notice is hereby given that the Board of Trustees of the Acton Agua Dulce Unified School District, County of Los Angeles, State of California, will hold a public hearing at its regular Board meeting on April 9, 2020 at 7:30p.m. in the District Office Board Room located at 32248 Crown Valley Road, Acton CA regarding contract negotiations for the Acton Agua Dulce Classified Employees Association for 2020-2021.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING CSEA 04-09-20

h1.span: NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING AND OF PROPOSAL

div.div: Posted by Acton-Agua Dulce Unified School District on 3/27/2020

div.p: NOTICEÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â NOTICEÂ
Â

p.strong: NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING AND OF PROPOSAL FOR IMPLEMENTING
SCHOOL FACILITIES FEES AS AUTHORIZED BY
EDUCATION CODE SECTION S 17620 AND GOVERNMENT CODES 65995

div.p: Â

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that immediately following a public hearing on the matter, a proposed resolution(s) will be considered by the Governing Board of Acton-Agua Dulce Unified School District at its regular meeting on April 9, 2020, at 7:30p.m., which if adopted by the Board will implement development fees established by the District against residential construction and reconstruction at $4.08 per square foot and against new commercial or industrial construction at $0.66 a square foot.Â Education Code Section 17620 and Government Code Section 65995 authorize the proposed fees.Â Data pertaining to the cost of school facilities is available for inspection during regular business hours at the Districtâ€™s administrative offices.Â The fee, if approved by the Governing Board, will become effective on Monday, June 8, 2020, which is 60 days after the proposed adoption of the resolution levying such fee by the Governing Board.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING AND OF PROPOSAL

p.strong: Tomorrow we are excited to kick off our first day of distance learning.

br.strong: I am very proud of our students and parents. I appreciate everyone's patience and flexibility. Our teachers have worked very hard this past week to prepare distance learning lessons. We are here to support you through this challenging time and ensure your child's education continues.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.strong: I am so proud of our staff, students, parents, the Board of Education, and the community.Â This is my first attempt at creating my own video.Â I hope it conveys a fraction of the gratitude I feel for the people I work with every day and our students.Â I will continue to post more videos that contain specific updates as I receive information from the Los Angeles County Office of Education and the California Department of Education.Â

span.strong: LA County Library Offers Temporary Digital Library Card

span.p: Customers Can Access eResources, Including eBooks, Movie Streaming, and Online Classes

Due to COVID-19 precautions, all of LA County Libraryâ€™s 86 locations are currently closed to the public through March 31, 2020. Due dates for borrowed materials have been automatically extended, no late fines will be assessed, and customers can return materials when the Library reopens.

div.p: In an effort to make access to all of the Libraryâ€™s digital resources more easily available to Los Angeles County residents, including those who do not currently have a library card, LA County Library is offering a temporary digital card, valid for 90 days. To sign up for a temporary digital card, LA County residents can visitÂ LACountyLibrary.org/library-cards.
Â

p.span: We are very excited to introduce our new Twitter feed!Â Please sign upÂ using
@aadusdstaygold! Check out what is happening at our schools and district by following us on Twitter!

div.p: Â

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Acton-Agua Dulce USD Twitter

div.p: Today, we'd like to share something a little different. This is an article that we at Acton-Agua Dulce USD found truly inspiring and we believe you will too! We hope you enjoy the read, and we thank Education Week for producing such fantastic content!

strong.a: Carol Dweck Revisits the 'Growth Mindset' - Education Week

p.em: "For many years, I secretly worked on my research. I say â€œsecretlyâ€ because, once upon a time, researchers simply published their research in professional journalsâ€”and there it stayed.

However, my colleagues and I learned things we thought people needed to know. We found that studentsâ€™ mindsetsâ€”how they perceive their abilitiesâ€”played a key role in their motivation and achievement, and we found that if we changed studentsâ€™ mindsets, we could boost their achievement. More precisely, students who believed their intelligence could be developed (a growth mindset) outperformed those who believed their intelligence was fixed (a fixed mindset). And when students learned through a structured program that they could â€œgrow their brainsâ€ and increase their intellectual abilities, they did better. Finally, we found that having children focus on the process that leads to learning (like hard work or trying new strategies) could foster a growth mindset and its benefits."
Photo by Sean Parker on Unsplash

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Carol Dweck Revisits the 'Growth Mindset'

h1.span: Vasquez High School has earned a Silver Medal according to US News and World Reports

div.div: Posted by District Staff on 8/30/2017 9:25:00 AM

div.h1: Vasquez High School has earned a Silver Medal according to US News and World Reports's annual evaluation of our nations's schools.Â Vasquez High School has been ranked #2483 Nationally out of 28,496 high schools, placingÂ VHS in the top 9% of all public high schools in the United States.Â Rankings are based on state-required test performance, APÂ participation and pass rates, graduation rate, and how well our high school prepares students for college.
div.p: Â

img.alt: Vasquez High School silver medal in US News and World Reports

div.p: Â

div.div: Posted by District Staff on 10/21/2016 1:00:00 PM

div.p: Â
div.h2: Where to buy a home? Top 10 improved school districts!
div.p: Our district schoolsÂ have been namedÂ Â number 7 on this list!Â Our ranking went from 49 out of 76 to being ranked 35. Â Â

For a number of years Acton Agua Dulce Unified School District has actively pursued significant improvementÂ inÂ all of our schools.Â After much hard work and dedication by our Board Members, District Superintendent,Â staff, andÂ community members these improvements have come to fruition.Â
We are not done!Â Our district will continue to improve!
Please read the actual article posted below.Â
